tn.text: Moses continues to remind the people of Israel about what happened in the past.
"After I finished praying"
"first" is the  ordinal number for one. It refers to the first set of tablets that Moses had broken. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
Here "the mountain" refers to Mount Sinai. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses continues to remind the people of Israel about what happened in the past.
Here "first" refers to the first tablets of stone. AT: "just like the first 2 tablets of stone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"went up Mount Sinai"

tn.ref: out of the middle of the fire
tn.text: It was as if Yahweh were a person standing in the middle of a fire and speaking with a loud voice. Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:09:09|9:10]]

tn.ref: on the day of the assembly
tn.text: The abstract noun "assembly" can be expressed as the verb "gather together." AT: "on the day when you Israelites all came and met together in one place." Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:09:09|9:10]].
Moses continues to remind the people of Israel about what happened in the past.
Here "I" refers to Moses.
"came down from Mount Sinai"
"in the box" or "in the chest" (UDB)
The writer gives a short account of where the Israelites had traveled. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

tn.ref: The people of Israel ... a land of streams of water
tn.text: This gives background information about where the people of Israel traveled. It also covers Aaron's natural death in Moserah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

tn.ref: Beeroth Bene Jaakan to Moserah ... Gudgodah ... Jotbathah
tn.text: These are names of different places the people of Israel went through while in the wilderness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translator may add a footnote: "The name 'Beeroth Bene Jaakan' means 'the wells that belonged to the people of Jaakan.'"
This can be translated in active form. AT: "that is where they buried him" or "the Israelites buried him there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of Aaron's son. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The writer gives background information about the tribe of Levi. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

tn.ref: to stand before Yahweh to serve him
tn.text: This is an idiom. "to offer the sacrifices that Yahweh requires" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"with the authority of Yahweh" or "as a representative of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"as they are doing today"

tn.ref: no portion nor inheritance of land
tn.text: The tribe of Levi did not receive a portion of the promised land when they arrived there. The full meaning of this statement may be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Yahweh speaks of the special relationship that Aaron and his descendants will have with him as if Yahweh were something that they will inherit. AT: "Yahweh is what they will have" or "Yahweh will allow them to serve him and he will provide for them through that service"
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the word "your" here is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"spoke to the tribe of Levi"
Moses resumes reminding the people of Israel about what happened in the past.

"first" is the ordinal number for one. Here it refers to the first time Moses went up Mount Sinai to receive the stone tablets from Yahweh. "as I did the first time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"40 days and 40 nights" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the word "you" here is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"take the land" or "take possession of the land"
This refers to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
"that I would give to you, their descendants"
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here the metonym "Israel" refers to the people of Israel. AT: "Now, people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: what does Yahweh your God require of you, except to fear ... for your own good?
tn.text: Moses uses a question to teach the people of Israel. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "this is what Yahweh your God requires you to do: to fear ... for your own good." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: to walk in all his ways
tn.text: Moses speaks as if obeying Yahweh were walking on a path. AT: "to obey all his commands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: with all your heart and with all your soul
tn.text: The idiom "with all your heart" means "completely" and "with all your soul" means "with all your being." These two phrases have a similar meaning. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:29|4:29]]. AT: "with all your being" or "with all your energy." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
The word "behold" emphasizes that what is said next is important. "Pay attention" or "Look" or "Listen"
These words show two extremes, and are combined to mean that all things everywhere belong to Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
This refers to the highest places in the heavens. Everything in the heavens belong to God.
Here the word "you" refers to all the Israelites and is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"Because of this"

tn.ref: circumcise the foreskin of your heart
tn.text: The word "foreskin" refers to the fold of skin on a man's private parts that is removed during circumcision. Here Moses is referring to a spiritual circumcision. This means the people must remove the sin from their lives. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"the supreme God" or "the only true God"
"the supreme Lord" or "the greatest Lord"
"the one who causes people to fear"
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: He executes justice for the fatherless
tn.text: "Yahweh makes sure that people treat the fatherless justly"
These are children whose parents have both died and do not have relatives to care for them.
A true widow is a woman whose husband has died and has no children to care for her in her old age.
"Because of this"
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"he is the one you must worship"

To have a good relationship with Yahweh and to completely rely on him is spoken of as if the person were clinging to Yahweh. AT: "You must rely on him" or "He is the one you must rely on" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: by his name will you swear
tn.text: To swear by the name of Yahweh means to make Yahweh the basis or the power on which the oath is made. Here "name" represents Yahweh himself. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:06:13|6:13]]. AT: "you will swear and ask Yahweh to confirm it" or "when you swear you will speak his name" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "eyes" refers to the whole person. AT: "which you yourselves have seen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Possible meanings are 1) "He is the one you must praise" or 2) "It is because you worship him that other peoples will praise you"
Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel as if they are one man, so "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"traveled south to Egypt" or "went to Egypt"
"70 persons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: as many as the stars of the heavens
tn.text: This emphasizes the large number of Israelites that were with Moses. AT: "more than you can count" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
